page.title: 07 INGESTRE HALL:THE FAMILY
page.content: The original Norman Manor House was occupied by Lord Hugo under the lordship of Robert de Stafford.In 1291 the house came into the possession of the Chetwynd family when one of Hugo's descendants married Philip de Chetwynd. By 1800 the house was owned by the Talbot family as a result of John Talbot's marriage to Catherine,daughter of John,second Viscount of Chetwynd in the eighteenth century. The Lord Talbot who inherited the hall 1785, did so through his mother a Chetwynd. His grandson, the 3rd Earl Talbot made a claim for the family title of Earl of Shrewsbury and Waterford. The 21st Earl of Shrewsbury, John Charles Chetwynd-Talbot, died in 1981, his son the 22nd Earl, lives in Shropshire.
